Individual: What has been your greatest leadership achievement in a professional environment? Talk through the steps you took to reach it.
Manage/Lead: Describe a leadership role of yours outside of work. Why did you commit your time to it? How did you feel about it?
Persuasion: Describe a recent unpopular decision you made. How did you implement/handle it? How was it received?
Analytical: Describe the project or situation that best demonstrates your analytical abilities. What was your role?
Challenge/Failure: Give an example of when you had to work with someone who was difficult to get along with. How/why was this person difficult? How did you handle it? How did the relationship progress?
Teamwork: Tell me about a time when you worked with a colleague who was not doing their share of the work. How did you handle it?

Individual: Describe a time when you have not only been responsible for leading a team of people but for also doing the same job as your team members? How did you juggle/balance your time?
Manage/Lead: What is the toughest group that you have ever had to lead? What were the obstacles? How did you handle the situation?
Persuasion: What, in your opinion, are the key ingredients in guiding and maintaining successful business relationships? Give me examples of how you have made these work for you.
Analytical: Tell me about a time when you had to analyze information and make a recommendation. What kind of thought process did you go through? Was the recommendation accepted? If not, why?
Challenge/Failure: Describe a situation where you had a conflict with another individual, and how you dealt with it. What was the outcome? How did you feel about it?
Teamwork: Describe a situation in which you had to arrive at a compromise or help others to compromise. What was your role? What steps did you take? What was the result?
Follow-up: How did this affect the future of the team?
Company 1: Tell me about a time when you re-invented yourself.

Follow-up: What did you learn from this?
Company 1: Have you ever improved a process?

Follow-up: What would you do differently if this situation came up again?
Do you always handle situations like this? If not, what made you handle things this way this time?
